sentence.Network_en: We ventilate a room by opening windows.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们开窗以使室内空气流通.
肺吸收新鲜空气使血液净化.

sentence.Network_en: He did not think it the job of officials to ventilate their doubts or daydreams.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为公开提出自己的疑问或不切实际的想法并非官员们的分内之事。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'winnow, scatter'): from Latin ventilat- 'blown, winnowed', from the verb ventilare, from ventus 'wind'. The sense ‘cause air to circulate in’ dates from the mid 18th cent

entry.tran: 使（房间或建筑）通风;使空气流通
entry.def: If you ventilate a room or building, you allow fresh air to get into it.

example.ex: Ventilate the room properly when paint stripping...
example.tran: 当油漆开始剥落时，要给房间适当通风。

example.ex: The pit is ventilated by a steel fan.
example.tran: 矿井中用钢制通风机来保持空气流通。

entry.def: If you ventilate your ideas or feelings, you talk about them or express them freely in front of other people.

example.ex: He did not think it the job of officials to ventilate their doubts or daydreams.
example.tran: 他认为公开提出自己的疑问或不切实际的想法并非官员们的分内之事。

means.word_mean: 1. expose to cool or cold air so as to cool or freshen;
2. expose to the circulation of fresh air so as to retard spoilage;

sentences.sentence: "The gust of air ventilated the room"

means.word_mean: 5. furnish with an opening to allow air to circulate or gas to escape;

sentences.sentence: "The architect did not thnk about ventilating the storage space"

auth_sentence.content: Many Nairobians were outraged and took to social media to ventilate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many Nairobians were outraged and took to social media to ventilate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many Nairobians were outraged and took to social media to ventilate.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 重大的,重要的,多变故的
stems_affixes.word_buile: event[n.事件,事情]+ful充满……的→事件多→多变故的
event[n.事件,事情]+ual……的→出事之后[最终]的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 善于发明或创造的,有发明或创造才能的
stems_affixes.word_buile: invent[v.发明,创造;捏造,虚构]+ive……的→adj.善于发明或创造的,有发明或创造才能的
prevent[v.[from]预防,防止,阻止,制止,妨碍]+ive……的→adj.预防性的
eventual[adj.最后的,结局的,最终的]+ly表副词→adv.最后, 终于
eventual最终的+ity表名词→最终可能发生的
inter之间+vent走+ion表名词→走在二者之间→干涉
invent发明,创造+ion表名词→n.发明, 创造
convention集会;习俗+ality表名词→n.陈规陋习,因袭传统
vent风→v.发泄[情绪],开孔 n.孔,口
ventilate[v.使通风;给…装通风设备]+ion表名词→n.通风
vent风→v.发泄[情绪],开孔 n.孔,口
vent风+ilate=ate表动词→v.使通风;给…装通风设备

sentences.en: We ventilate a room by opening windows.
sentences.cn: 我们开窗以使室内空气流通。

means.word_mean: 公开，公开讨论，公开表达（感情或意见）

sentences.en: The matter should not be hushed up, but freely ventilated.
sentences.cn: 这事不应掩盖起来, 而应该公开自由讨论。

jushi.english: The matter should be freely ventilated.
jushi.chinese: 这事应该公开自由讨论。

jushi.english: The workers are ventilating the galleries of a coal mine.
jushi.chinese: 工人们正在给煤矿坑道通风。

jushi.english: Members are asked not to ventilate club problems outside this meeting.
jushi.chinese: 要求会员们在这次会议之外勿公开讨论本俱乐部问题。
